title: 'Working well since 2 years'
body: 'Nice product with retro looks. Though the build quality could have been better

title: 'Retro but modern'
body: 'The old-fashioned tuning dial and operating it to change the radio stations
column7: the adjustment of antenna (only at times) to get the perfect signal gives you the feel of a truly antique gadget.  On a lighter note
column8: the reason I bought it is that it reminded me of almost a similar looking radio that my Nana ji (grandfather) had
column9: maybe it was a little more lengthy and heavy.  So far no issues with it\'s features
column12: I highly recommend a "buy" üëçüèæ if you are looking for a retro-styled radio with modern tech features like bluetooth.'

title: 'Looks and feels great'
body: First of all keep your expectations in check, this is strictly a radio with Bluetooth connectivity option. Now that we have set a baseline, its a good product for what it claims, it looks and feels like a vintage radio. Sound is decent and loud good for listening to AM,SW,FM you don't need it to have a booming bass with a passive radiator. On some levels its simple nature is kind of calming, people who grew up listening to radio will know what i am talking about.  No QC issues as of opening the box and using for 4 hours, i will edit the review if i see any issues down the line.
